snippet: Sabirhan Hasanoff, who was also accused of scouting the New York Stock Exchange for a possible attack, received two years less than the maximum sought by prosecutors.
abstract: Sabirhan Hasanoff, former Brooklyn man accused of conducting surveillance of New York Stock Exchange for a possible terrorist attack, is sentenced to 18 years in prison; Hasanoff pleaded guilty in 2012 to providing material support to Al Qaeda along with conspiracy charge.
lead_paragraph: Sabirhan Hasanoff, who was also accused of scouting the New York Stock Exchange for a possible attack, received two years less than the maximum sought by prosecutors.

headline.main: Man Who Aided Al Qaeda Gets 18-Year Prison Sentence
headline.print_headline: 18-Year Term for Man Who Aided Al Qaeda
